diagnoses.primary_diagnosis: Inferior ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) heart attack

clinical_summary.clinical_summary: Mrs Grey was admitted via a Primary Angioplasty in Myocardial Infarction (PAMI) call to the cath lab where she underwent revascularisation with a successful percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) to right coronary artery (RCA) with a drug-eluting stent (DES). She developed a chesty cough a few days post procedure associated with a mild rise in inflammatory markers which was treated as an IECOPD with oral doxycycline. Otherwise she has made a good clinical recovery.
procedures: PCI to distal mid vessel and distal RCA with DES
Residual diffuse left anterior descending (LAD) disease with moderate to severe D1 disease (for initial medical management)
investigation_results: ECHO: The left ventricle is normal in size; left ventricular fraction is mildly reduced ejection fraction (EF) 45%. Overall the right ventricular systolic function is at least mildly impaired. At least mild mitral regurgitation. Moderate sized septal and inferior wall motion abnormality with hypokinesis to akinesis of the segments.
